document_title: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 23 for SLE 12 SP5)

document_notes.text: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 23 for SLE 12 SP5)
document_notes.title: Topic

document_notes.text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 4.12.14-122_88 fixes several issues.

The following security issues were fixed:

- CVE-2022-27666: Fixed a buffer overflow vulnerability in IPsec ESP transformation code. This flaw allowed a local attacker with a normal user privilege to overwrite kernel heap objects and may cause a local privilege escalation. (bnc#1197462)
- CVE-2022-22942: Fixed stale file descriptors on failed usercopy. (bsc#1195065)

notes.text: ** RESERVED ** This candidate has been reserved by an organization or individual that will use it when announcing a new security problem. When the candidate has been publicized, the details for this candidate will be provided.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: A heap buffer overflow flaw was found in IPsec ESP transformation code in net/ipv4/esp4.c and net/ipv6/esp6.c. This flaw allows a local attacker with a normal user privilege to overwrite kernel heap objects and may cause a local privilege escalation threat.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".
